meanings.definition: A garment worn on the foot and lower part of the leg, typically knitted or woven.
meanings.sent1: I put on a cozy sock to keep my foot warm.
meanings.sent2: She bought colorful socks to match her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The sock had a secret pocket for hiding treasures.
meanings.sent4: His sock was like a rainbow wrapping around his foot.
meanings.sent5: The sock danced off the clothesline in the wind.

meanings.sent1: He received a strong sock to the jaw during the fight.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a powerful sock to his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The clown's sock made everyone laugh instead of cry.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit him like a sock to the stomach.
meanings.sent5: The sock of truth knocked some sense into him.

meanings.sent1: I socked the ball with all my might.
meanings.sent2: She socked the door closed in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: He socked the bully right in the nose.
meanings.sent4: The storm socked the town with heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The news of the loss socked him hard.
